poem:
**Three Fronts, One Battlefield**

On three fronts, the Tory flag falters,
A half-hearted fight in a storm of bluster:
Labour to left, Reform to the right,
Lib Dems circling, a swarm in the night.

Yet shadows loom larger, unseen peril,
While they joust old dragons, the land turns feral.
A house divided, blind to its plight,
Lost in the skirmish, forgetting the fight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Tories are fixating on Reform. They should be focused on a far bigger threat | Martin Kettle In this general election, the Conservatives are supposed to be fighting a campaign on three fronts. One is against Labour, a second is against Reform and the third is against the Liberal Democrats. The Conservatives’ problem is partly that they are not fighting very well and partly that they are only fighting on two of the fronts,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
